alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:32AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...AN AREA OF MODERATE TO BRIEFLY HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN ALLEGANY AND NORTHERN GARRETT COUNTIES... At 229 AM EST, an area of moderate to briefly heavy snow showers was located along a line extending from St. Michael to 9 miles southeast of Triadelphia. Movement was east at 35 mph. Locations impacted include... Frostburg, La Vale, Grantsville, Friendsville, Accident, Eckhart Mines, Mount Savage, Ellerslie, Corriganville, Midlothian, Keysers Ridge, Jennings, Mineral Spring, Selbysport, New Germany and Piney Grove. This includes Interstate 68 in Maryland between mile markers 1 and 39. Quick accumulations of a coating to one half of an inch are possible on all surfaces as temperatures quickly drop along the boundary associated with the snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
